N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 576.7 - Documentation requirements for reserved bed days

State Regulations
(a) The residential treatment facility shall
maintain a register of each resident who is absent from the residential
treatment facility for 24 hours beyond the normal census-taking hour. Such
register shall include, at a minimum, the resident's name, the reason for the
absence and the final disposition of the absence. (b) The temporary hospitalization or leave of
absence for a therapy day shall be documented in the case record. At a minimum, progress notes shall be written describing the reason for the temporary
hospitalization or leave of absence for a therapy day; the duration; any
significant events that occurred; and the effects, if any, on the resident's
condition or course of treatment. (c) The residential treatment facility shall
document, in accordance with procedures prescribed by the Office of Mental

Health all actions required to demonstrate compliance with the requirements of
this Part, including telephone notification and correspondence with hospitals, requests for extensions and approvals of extensions. Such documentation shall
be retained by the residential treatment facility. Notes
